title: Black Lives Matter in rural England
description: Khady Gueye received threats for trying to support Black Lives Matter in rural Gloucestershire.

title: Meet the socially distant robot scientist
description: While the research labs have been locked down, one robotic scientist has continued experimenting 24/7.

title: Coronavirus: 'Very different' reopening of National Gallery
description: The National Gallery is reopening on 8 July after being closed for more than 100 days because of coronavirus.

title: Body positivity movement: 'Why is my body not important?'
description: The body positivity movement has taken over social media and forced the diet industry to reinvent itself, but not all feel included.

title: The gaming boss who gets addicted to the games
description: Andrew Day, the CEO of games developer Keywords Studios, tries not to play the titles himself.

title: Working from home: 'I'm a bit brainier than he thought I was'
description: What we've learned from watching our other halves work from home during the coronavirus lockdown.

title: Coronavirus: No quarantine checks carried out on passengers arriving in Scotland
description: The Scottish government says its officials have not had access to the information on who is arriving in Scotland.

title: Newcastle held at home by relegation-threatened West Ham
description: Newcastle United twice came from behind to deny relegation-threatened West Ham a second consecutive Premier League victory for the first time since August.

title: Lewis Hamilton penalised for collision as Valtteri Bottas wins in Austrian GP
description: Valtteri Bottas survives reliability worries to win an incident-packed Austrian Grand Prix as Lewis Hamilton takes fourth after a penalty.

title: Coronavirus: What are the changes to places of worship?
description: Churches, mosques and other places of worship have reopened in England - but with changes.

title: Coronavirus: 'Crystal clear' drunk people will not socially distance
description: As people in England enjoy their first night out in months, police voice fears about social distancing.

title: Coronavirus: Records broken at socially distanced hot dog contest
description: Safety measures did not put off the champions, who ate 75 and 48.5 hot dogs respectively in 10 minutes.

title: Leicester lockdown: Hancock 'worried' about practices at clothing factories
description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock says he is "very worried about employment practices in some factories".

title: Egerton crash: Girl dies and three seriously hurt
description: The police watchdog has been informed because a Kent Police vehicle was "in close proximity".

title: Social care reform needed within a year - NHS England boss
description: Sir Simon Stevens tells the BBC the Covid-19 crisis has shone a "very harsh spotlight" on the sector.

title: Coronavirus: 'Super Saturday' tales as bars reopen
description: How did it feel to be out again, as the night-time economy in England reopened after lockdown?

title: Coronavirus lockdown easing: Crowds in London's Soho celebrate
description: People partied late into the night as coronavirus lockdown restrictions were eased in England.

title: Underwater cave in Mexico reveals ancient Mayan secrets
description: Divers on Mexico's Yucatan Peninsula find evidence of a mining operation started 12,000 years ago.

title: Kanye West again says he will run for president
description: The US rapper claims that he has entered the 2020 race but it is unclear if he has actually registered.

title: NHS anniversary: PM to join nationwide clap to celebrate health service
description: People across the UK will applaud later to celebrate 72 years since the founding of the health service.

title: Vogue Portugal defends controversial mental health cover
description: The magazine says it was trying to raise awareness after it was accused of using dystopian imagery.

title: Coronavirus: The priest treating patients during crisis
description: Christopher Gault left medicine for the priesthood, but returned to a hospital during the pandemic.

title: Greatest Fights: Corrales, Castillo, a turnaround and a tragedy
description: Diego Corrales hit the canvas twice in round 10, but there was to be one last twist in his thrilling bout with Jose Luis Castillo.

title: England v West Indies: Holder v Stokes and a breakout star
description: West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite picks out the players England should be wary of when the Test series starts this week.

title: The Papers: Row over NHS cash pledge and PM's Huawei 5G 'ban'
description: Celebrations as pubs and hairdressers reopen in England also make many of Sunday's front pages.

title: Coronavirus: How will London's economy look after lockdown?
description: Experts have differing views about how the capital will emerge from the pandemic.

title: Tribal Clash: Refunds row beach fitness firm 'facing bankruptcy'
description: Tribal Clash says there is "no cash" after cancelling events around the world because of coronavirus.

title: 'Email from dad after his death made my birthday’
description: How one father's email after his death has led people to share their stories of grief and loss.

title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Bradford worries about the whack-a-mole mallet
description: Bradford is second in the UK's Covid-19 league table, says Dr John Wright, because it's a table of inequality.

title: 'I left her as a baby - 16 years later she saved my life'
description: When Matjames Metson hit rock bottom after Hurricane Katrina, it was the daughter he hadn't seen for 16 years who turned his life around.
